    • Uses of Evaluation in sorcer.core

      Subinterfaces of Evaluation in sorcer.core 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  InclusiveContext
      The InclusiveContext is an interface designed to enable CDS providers to encapsulate the query for data from multiple EDS providers into a single request.

    • Uses of Evaluation in sorcer.core.context

      Subinterfaces of Evaluation in sorcer.core.context 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  IControlContext 
      Classes in sorcer.core.context that implement Evaluation 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ArrayContext
      The Array dataContext has an array like access to a service dataContext.
      class  ComprehensiveContext
      The Comprehensive Context is a data structure designed to enable CDS providers to encapsulate the query for data from multiple EDS providers into a single request.
      class  ControlContext 
      class  ListContext<T>
      ServiceContext implementing the java.util.List interface.
      class  PositionalContext<T> 
      class  ServiceContext<T>
      Implements the base-level service context interface Context.
      class  SharedAssociativeContext
      SpaceContext persists its dataContext nodes in a distributed array in JavaSpace with the name provided in the constructor.
      class  SharedIndexedContext<T>
      ServiceContext implementing the java.util.List interface.

    • Uses of Evaluation in sorcer.core.context.model.par

      Classes in sorcer.core.context.model.par that implement Evaluation 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Agent<T> 
      class  Par<T>
      In service-based modeling, a parameter (for short a par) is a special kind of variable, used in a service context ParModel to refer to one of the pieces of data provided as input to the invokers (subroutines of the context).
      class  ParModel<T>
      The ParModel is a shared service context as a map of parameters (Pars), parameter name and its argument is the definition of a independent and dependent arguments.
      Methods in sorcer.core.context.model.par that return Evaluation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Evaluation<T> Par.substitute(Arg... parameters)

    • Uses of Evaluation in sorcer.service

      Subinterfaces of Evaluation in sorcer.service 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  CompoundExertion 
      interface  Context<T>
      Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
      interface  Evaluator<T>
      A functionality required by all evaluators in SORCER.
      interface  Exertion
      An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Service.service(sorcer.service.Exertion, net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction), to a service provider Service.
      Classes in sorcer.service that implement Evaluation 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Block 
      class  Condition
      A Condition specifies a conditional value in a given service context for its free variables in the form of path/value pairs with paths being guards's parameters.
      class  Job
      A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
      class  ServiceExertion 
      class  Task
      A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
      Methods in sorcer.service that return Evaluation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Evaluation<Object> Condition.substitute(Arg... entries) 
      Evaluation<T> Evaluation.substitute(Arg... entries)
      Realizes the substitution for this evaluation with respect to the provided parameters.
